results.title: The Magic of the faraway tree. [Vol. 2] = More adventures at the faraway tree
results.creator_credit: Ben Turner, Abbey Home Entertainment and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Enchanted lands”.
A compilation of six short animated stories from Enid Blyton’s Enchanted Lands series, “The Magic of the faraway tree” featuring more fantastic adventures with Joe, Fran and Beth and their Faraway Tree friends. Be amazed in the land of Giants, careful in the land of Topsy Turvy where you might end upside down, and watch those magic spells in the land of Wizards. Excellent animation with lots of colour and movement. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: A Lesson to us all
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face Australia”.
Outwardly, Japan is an economic and industrial giant, whose growth from the ashes of WWII into a powerful trading nation is a remarkable success story. This film looks at both sides of the Japanese story, contrasting the nation’s material wealth and manufacturing efficiency with the divisions created by changed social conditions, the tragic effects of uncontrolled pollution and pessimistic outlooks of concerned citizens.

results.title: Line
results.creator_credit: Paul Harrison, Lewis Jacobs and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elements of design”.
Straight, curved, S-shaped and circular lines are established as being the basis of linear design. Examples in nature stress the need for being aware of line designs in the physical world. There are illustrations of historical use of line in many ways, times, and places. The elements of repetition and rhythm are pointed out in nature, industrial design and architecture

results.title: Living in Two Worlds
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Face Australia”.
Looks at a suburban industrial “ghetto” in Wollongong which is made up almost entirely of migrants.

results.title: Shape
results.creator_credit: Lewis Jacobs and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elements of design”.
Discusses shape as one of the basic elements of design, and its function in the art and industry of everyday life. Shows the effects achieved by use of circles, squares, rectangles, triangles, and their various combinations

results.title: Horse
results.creator_credit: Justine Kershaw, Ben Southwell, Oregon Public Broadcasting, Dorling Kindersley Vision, Wildvision and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Eyewitness”.
Horses are an important part of the history of civilisation. Humankind harnessed the energy but never mastered the beast. The fifth fastest land mammal, the horse is the “Marathon” winner of the animal kingdom, renown for its strength and endurance. This program looks at the physionomy of the horse and different horse species such as zebras and donkeys. The horse has occupied a place not only in the history of human beings but in our myths, legends and superstitions. Stunning photography and a behind-the-scenes-look at the making of the program ensure this program is an enriching experience for all ages.

results.title: Light and shade
results.creator_credit: Lewis Jacobs and Young America Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Elements of design”.
Discusses light and shade as one of the basic elements of design. To the trained eye, light and shade reveal form, provide dramatic effect, establish harmony or mood and create decorative patterns. This film conveys that elements of design are inherent in the patterns of nature and are effectively employed in works of art
